name: hazardous waste incineration facility construction | hazardous waste incineration facility | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/2501/documentation

adapted from municipal waste incineration plant with a factor of 0.36. 20000 tons of waste per year. Operation time 40 years.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]



plant building infrastructure and demolition, land occupations and transformations
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects
tags: Sector: Infrastructure & Machinery; Waste Treatment & Recycling

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Based on technology encountered in Switzerland in 2000. Well applicable to modern incineration practices in Europe or North America or Japan.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Swiss HWI plant in 2000 with wet flue gas scrubber and low-dust SCR DeNOx facility.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: adapted from municipal waste incineration plant with a factor of 0.36
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The 2 Swiss HWI plants, used as the inventory reference technology mix, have a total annual capacity of 53'000 tons of hazardous waste. This corresonds to 39% of the Swiss total installed capacity in 2000. Swiss average plants size is 20'000 t/a.
